title: Enemy team reports should only scan the all chat and after game chat
body: There is no reason that an enemy report should scan the pre-game and in game team chat, because the enemy didn't see those at all, and the report should only be based on their all chat and after game chat. Having enemy teams report a player for something light they did (typing gg ez), only for them to be handed a more severe punishment for something they typed in team chat that was meant as a joke.

replies.body:
So...people can avoid punishment via a loophole? I don't think so.

> only for them to be handed a more severe punishment for something they typed in team chat

?

This is not how the system works at all.

Also, ggez is punishable. Calling it light, under the current system, is not a correct interpretation of the rules. You're talking to a bot when it comes to what words constitute reportable behavior. Black and white. No exceptions.

Not that I approve of it, but until it's reformed, that is the system we play under.
